feed.title: Azure Architecture Center
feed.subtitle: Updated articles for Azure Architecture Center

entry.title: SaaS and multitenant solution architecture
entry.summary: This guide provides an overview of the architectural content for SaaS, startups, and multitenancy and guidance about architecting multitenant solutions on Azure.

entry.title: Azure Governance Visualizer Accelerator guidance
entry.summary: Azure Governance Visualizer Accelerator guidance to streamline the process of deploying and maintaining the Azure Governance Visualizer tool.

entry.title: SWIFT Alliance Remote Gateway with Alliance Connect Virtual on Azure
entry.summary: Deploy and run SWIFT Alliance Remote Gateway with Alliance Connect Virtual on Azure. Migrate or establish new SWIFT connectivity in Azure.

entry.title: Deploy Ansys Speos on an Azure virtual machine
entry.summary: Find out how Ansys Speos optical-system simulation software performs on an Azure virtual machine (VM).

entry.title: Health Endpoint Monitoring pattern
entry.summary: Implement the functional checks of the Health Endpoint Monitoring pattern. Use external tools to check apps at regular intervals through exposed endpoints.

entry.title: Index Table pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the Index Table pattern. Create indexes over the fields in data stores that are frequently referenced by queries.

entry.title: Leader Election pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to use the Leader Election pattern to coordinate the actions performed by a collection of collaborating task instances in a distributed application.

entry.title: Materialized View pattern
entry.summary: Generate prepopulated views over the data in one or more data stores when the data isn't ideally formatted for required query operations.

entry.title: Messaging Bridge pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to use the Messaging Bridge pattern to integrate disparate systems built on top of different messaging infrastructures.

entry.title: Pipes and Filters pattern
entry.summary: Break down a task that performs complex processing into a series of separate elements that can be reused or reordered.

entry.title: Priority Queue pattern
entry.summary: Prioritize requests sent to services so that requests with a higher priority are received and processed more quickly than those with a lower priority.

entry.title: Publisher-Subscriber pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the Publisher-Subscriber pattern, which enables an application to announce events to many interested consumers asynchronously.

entry.title: Quarantine pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the quarantine pattern, which stops software from getting deployed to production until marked as trusted by an intermediary process.

entry.title: Queue-Based Load Leveling pattern
entry.summary: Use a queue that acts as a buffer between a task and a service that it invokes in order to smooth intermittent heavy loads.

entry.title: Rate Limiting pattern
entry.summary: You can use a rate limiting pattern to help you avoid or minimize throttling errors.

entry.title: Retry pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to use the Retry pattern to enable an application to handle anticipated, temporary failures when the app tries to connect to a service or network resource.

entry.title: Scheduler Agent Supervisor pattern
entry.summary: Explore the Scheduler Agent Supervisor pattern, which coordinates a set of actions across a distributed set of services and other remote resources.

entry.title: Sequential Convoy pattern
entry.summary: The sequential convoy cloud design pattern allows for first-in-first-out processing of data in a serverless environment.

entry.title: Sharding pattern
entry.summary: Use the Sharding design pattern to divide a data store into a set of horizontal partitions or shards.

entry.title: Sidecar pattern
entry.summary: Deploy components of an application into a separate process or container to provide isolation and encapsulation.

entry.title: Static Content Hosting pattern
entry.summary: Deploy static content to a cloud-based storage service that can deliver them directly to the client.

entry.title: Strangler Fig pattern
entry.summary: Incrementally migrate a legacy system by gradually replacing specific pieces of functionality with new applications and services.

entry.title: Throttling pattern
entry.summary: Control the consumption of resources used by an instance of an application, an individual tenant, or an entire service.

entry.title: Valet Key pattern
entry.summary: Use a token or key that provides clients with restricted direct access to a specific resource or service.

entry.title: Intelligent e-commerce product search engine
entry.summary: This example scenario shows how using a dedicated search service can dramatically increase the relevance of search results for your e-commerce customers.

entry.title: Databases architecture design
entry.summary: Learn about the different Azure database solutions described in Azure Architecture Center.

entry.title: Migrate from Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
entry.summary: Learn about options for migrating from Amazon EKS to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

entry.title: Host a Murex MX.3 workload on Azure using SQL
entry.summary: Learn how to implement an Azure architecture for Murex workloads using SQL Server as the database.

entry.title: IPv6 hub-spoke network topology
entry.summary: Learn how to transition a hub-and-spoke network topology in Azure so it supports IPv6, which creates a dual-stack network.

entry.title: Quarantine pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the quarantine pattern, which stops software from getting deployed to production until marked as trusted by an intermediary process.

entry.title: Deploy TUFLOW HPC on an Azure virtual machine
entry.summary: Learn how to install and run benchmark tests with TUFLOW HPC. See the results of running TUFLOW HPC on Azure virtual machines.

entry.summary: The Team Data Science Process (TDSP) provides a recommended lifecycle that you can use to structure your data science projects.

entry.summary: Learn how to move data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SQL Server Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure.

entry.summary: Learn how the Team Data Science Process provides a data science methodology to deliver predictive analytics solutions and intelligent applications.

entry.summary: Preprocess and clean data to prepare it to be used effectively for machine learning.

entry.summary: Learn about the tasks that an individual contributor performs on a Team Data Science Process team, including how they can incorporate language models and copilots.

entry.summary: Learn about the tasks that a project lead performs on a Team Data Science Process team, including how they can incorporate language models and copilots.

entry.summary: Learn about the outline of key components, personnel roles, and associated tasks for a data science group that uses the Team Data Science Process.

entry.summary: Guidance on a set of objectives that are typically used to implement comprehensive data science solutions with Azure technologies using the Team Data Science Process and Azure Machine Learning.

entry.summary: Learn about the tasks that a team lead performs on a Team Data Science Process team, including how they can incorporate language models and copilots.

entry.summary: Icons for use in building architecture diagrams for Azure

entry.summary: Learn how to use Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search to search documents in your enterprise data and retrieve results.

entry.summary: Learn about the different Azure database solutions described in Azure Architecture Center.

entry.title: General considerations for choosing an Azure container service
entry.summary: Get a quick overview of common feature-level considerations that can help you choose an Azure container service. Part two of a series.

entry.title: Zero-trust network for web applications with Azure Firewall and Application Gateway
entry.summary: Protect web apps by implementing zero-trust security in virtual networks. Use Azure Firewall and Azure Application Gateway in networks to maximize protection.

entry.title: Firewall, App Gateway for virtual networks
entry.summary: Learn about options and best practices for using Azure Firewall and Azure Application Gateway security in virtual networks.

entry.title: Ambassador pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the Ambassador pattern, which creates helper services that send network requests on behalf of a consumer service or application.

entry.title: Anti-corruption Layer pattern
entry.summary: Examine the Anti-corruption Layer pattern. Implement a faÃ§ade or adapter layer between a modern application and a legacy system.

entry.title: Asynchronous Request-Reply pattern
entry.summary: Allow decoupling of backend processing from a frontend host, where backend processing needs to be asynchronous, but the frontend still needs a clear response.

entry.title: Backends for Frontends pattern
entry.summary: Explore the Backends for Frontends pattern, which creates separate backend services to be consumed by specific frontend applications or interfaces.

entry.title: Bulkhead pattern
entry.summary: Isolate elements of an application into pools so that if one fails, the others will continue to function.

entry.title: Cache-Aside pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to load data on demand into a cache, which can improve performance and maintain consistency between cached data and the underlying data store.

entry.title: Choreography pattern
entry.summary: Let each service decide when and how a business operation is processed, instead of depending on a central orchestrator.

entry.title: Circuit Breaker pattern
entry.summary: Handle faults that might take a variable amount of time to fix when connecting to a remote service or resource.

entry.title: Claim-Check pattern
entry.summary: Examine the Claim-Check pattern, which splits a large message into a claim check and a payload to avoid overwhelming a message bus.

entry.title: Compensating Transaction pattern
entry.summary: Use the Compensating Transaction pattern to undo work when a step of an eventually consistent operation fails.

entry.title: Competing Consumers pattern
entry.summary: Explore the Competing Consumers pattern. This pattern enables many concurrent consumers to process messages that are received on the same messaging channel.

entry.title: Compute Resource Consolidation pattern
entry.summary: Use the Compute Resource Consolidation design pattern to consolidate multiple tasks or operations into a single computational unit.

entry.title: CQRS pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to segregate operations that read data from those that update data, using the CQRS (Command and Query Responsibility Segregation) pattern.

entry.title: Deployment Stamps pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the Deployment Stamps pattern, which deploys many independent copies (known as stamps, service units, or scale units) of application components.

entry.title: Event Sourcing pattern
entry.summary: Use an append-only store to record the full series of events that describe actions taken on data in a domain.

entry.title: External Configuration Store pattern
entry.summary: Examine the External Configuration Store pattern, which moves configuration information out of the application deployment package to a centralized location.

entry.title: Federated Identity pattern
entry.summary: Use the Federated Identity design pattern to delegate authentication to an external identity provider.

entry.title: Gatekeeper pattern
entry.summary: Learn how to use the Gatekeeper pattern to protect applications and services by using a dedicated host instance as a broker to validate requests and data.

entry.title: Gateway Aggregation pattern
entry.summary: Learn about the Gateway Aggregation pattern, which uses a gateway to aggregate many individual requests into a single request.

entry.title: Gateway Offloading pattern
entry.summary: Use the Gateway Offloading design pattern to offload shared or specialized service functionality to a gateway proxy.

entry.title: Gateway Routing pattern
entry.summary: Use the Gateway Routing design pattern to route requests to multiple services using a single endpoint.

entry.title: Geode pattern
entry.summary: Deploy backend services into a set of geographical nodes, each of which can service any client request in any region.

entry.title: Multitenancy and Azure Event Hubs
entry.summary: Learn about the Azure Event Hubs features and isolation models that you can use to implement an event-driven architecture for a multitenant system.
